name: add-headers
doc: The root configuration for the Repose IP Classification filter configuration file.

assert.message: At least one header must be defined.

items.doc: Add Header can be used to add a new header with specific value to a request chain. Optionally you can remove the old header, which is left in by default. Values are limited to 4096 characters.
items.name: header
value
items.doc: This limits header value to 4096 characters.

items.name: quality
items.doc:
Quality assigned to users found in the request headers.
                                If no quality is set, Repose will default this value to 0.1
                            
                                Quality factors are defined in the
                                HTTP RFC -
                                    Section-3.9
                                
                                (for usage examples, seeHTTP RFC - Section
                                14.1)
                                as a mechanism for weighting values in multi-value headers.
                                Possible values for quality are 0 to 1.0.
